member.summary: Computes a value that indicates the similarity between two strings. "Similarity" is defined as the number of characters that are the same in both strings, divided by the length of the longer string. As such, the value returned by this method is always between 0 (the strings are have no characters in common) and 1 (the strings are equal), inclusive.
member.param: The first to use for the comparison.
The second to use for the comparison.
A instance to use when comparing the s. Defaults to .
member.returns: The computed similarity as described.

member.summary: A of mapping overrides. When a is resolved using , before any other matching is done, the input to the method is checked against this . If a match is found, the from the is returned.
member.remarks: Contrary to all other matching, this matching is case-sensitive. If an override is added for, for example, "united states" with a value of "en-US", the inputs "United states", "united States", "United States" or "UNITED STATES" will not match the override.

The data to analyze and resolve to a . The following formats are supported:
A standard identifier in languagecode2-country/regioncode2 format (), e.g. en-US.
A standard (generic) identifier in languagecode2 format (), e.g. en.
One of the following special values: , , whitespace-only, Invariant (which all resolve to ), Current (which resolves to ), UI (which resolves to ).
One of the generic culture identifiers that are returned by .
One of the specific culture identifiers that are returned by , , or , or a partial match of one of these (however, exact matches are always higher priority and, as such, evaluated first).
member.returns: A instance that matches the given data, or if no match was found.

remarks.list: "Natural" preferences (such as the expectation that United States should return the for en-US and not chr-US) cannot be taken into account. As such, you may use to manually cater to preferences within your application.
